text: The 1984 Soviet Cup was an association football cup competition of the Soviet Union. The winner of the competition, Dinamo Moscow qualified for the continental tournament. ==Competition schedule== ===First preliminary round=== All games took place on February 18, 1984. {| style="width:100%;" cellspacing="1" |- !width=20%| !width=12%| !width=20%| ! |- style=font- size:90% |align=right| Fakel Voronezh |align=center|2:1 | Tekstilschik Ivanovo |(in Sochi) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Guria Lanchkhuti |align=center|1:2 | Daugava Riga |(in Alakhadze) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Kairat Alma-Ata |align=center|1:1 | SKA Kiev |, (in Chimkent) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Kolos Nikopol |align=center|0:1 | Znamya Truda Orekhovo Zuevo | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Kuban Krasnodar |align=center|1:0 | Irtysh Omsk | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Kuzbass Kemerovo |align=center|3:1 | Zvezda Jizak | (in Uzhgorod) |- style=font- size:90% |align=right| Lokomotiv Moscow |align=center|0:2 | Iskra Smolensk | (in Khosta) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Metallurg Zaporozhie |align=center|2:0 | Krylia Sovetov Kuibyshev | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Nistru Kishinev |align=center|2:0 | Neftyanik Fergana | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Pamir Dushanbe |align=center|1:1 | Dinamo Kirov |, (in Kurgan-Tyube) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Rotor Volgograd |align=center|1:2 | Dnepr Mogilev | (in Adler) |- style=font- size:90% |align=right| SKA Khabarovsk |align=center|2:1 | Zaria Voroshilovgrad | (in Moscow) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| SKA Rostov-na-Donu |align=center|1:0 | Shakhter Karaganda | (in Sochi) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| SKA Karpaty Lvov |align=center|1:0 | Spartak Ordzhonikidze | (in Moscow) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Tavria Simferopol |align=center|3:1 | Dinamo Batumi | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Torpedo Kutaisi |align=center|3:1 | Metallurg Lipetsk | |} ===Second preliminary round=== The base game day was February 22, 1984 {| style="width:100%;" cellspacing="1" |- !width=20%| !width=12%| !width=20%| ! |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Dinamo Moscow |align=center|1:0 | Nistru Kishinev | (February 21, 1984) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Chernomorets Odessa |align=center|3:0 | Kuban Krasnodar | (in Izmail) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| CSKA Moscow |align=center|1:0 | Dnepr Mogilev | (in Sochi) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Dinamo Kiev |align=center|3:1 | SKA-Karpaty Lvov | (in Sochi) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Dinamo Minsk |align=center|2:1 | SKA Khabarovsk | (in Sukhumi) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Dnepr Dnepropetrovsk |align=center|3:2 | Kuzbass Kemerovo | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Iskra Smolensk |align=center|0:1 | Spartak Moscow | (in Sochi) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Metallist Kharkov |align=center|2:0 | Metallurg Zaporozhie | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Neftchi Baku |align=center|2:4 | SKA Rostov- na-Donu | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Pakhtakor Tashkent |align=center|0:1 | Fakel Voronezh | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Shakhter Donetsk |align=center|2:0 | Torpedo Kutaisi | (in Sochi) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| SKA Kiev |align=center|0:2 | Dinamo Tbilisi | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Torpedo Moscow |align=center|3:0 | Tavria Simferopol | (in Adler) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Znamya Truda Orekhovo-Zuevo |align=center|0:1 | Ararat Yerevan | |- style=font- size:90% |align=right| Zhalgiris Vilnius |align=center|2:0 | Pamir Dushanbe | (in Adler) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Daugava Riga |align=center|0:3 | Zenit Leningrad | (in Fergana, February 23, 1984) |} ===Round of 16=== The base game day was February 26, 1984 {| style="width:100%;" cellspacing="1" |- !width=20%| !width=12%| !width=20%| ! |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Chernomorets Odessa |align=center|1:0 | Shakhter Donetsk | |- style=font- size:90% |align=right| CSKA Moscow |align=center|4:2 | Dinamo Kiev | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Dinamo Tbilisi |align=center|0:1 | Dinamo Minsk | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Dnepr Dnepropetrovsk |align=center|1:2 | Dinamo Moscow | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Metallist Kharkov |align=center|1:2 | Torpedo Moscow | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Spartak Moscow |align=center|1:0 | SKA Rostov-na-Donu | (in Sochi) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Zhalgiris Vilnius |align=center|0:1 | Fakel Voronezh | (in Adler) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Zenit Leningrad |align=center|3:3 | Ararat Yerevan |, (February 27, 1984) |} ===Quarter-finals=== The base game day was March 2, 1984 {| style="width:100%;" cellspacing="1" |- !width=20%| !width=12%| !width=20%| ! |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Dinamo Minsk |align=center|1:0 | CSKA Moscow | (in Sukhumi) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Dinamo Moscow |align=center|3:1 | Chernomorets Odessa | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Torpedo Moscow |align=center|0:0 | Zenit Leningrad |, (in Sochi, March 3, 1984) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Fakel Voronezh |align=center|2:0 | Spartak Moscow (April 28, 1984) | |} ===Semi-finals=== {| style="width:100%;" cellspacing="1" |- !width=20%| !width=12%| !width=20%| ! |- style=font- size:90% |align=right| Zenit Leningrad |align=center|1:0 | Fakel Voronezh | (June 6, 1984) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Dinamo Minsk |align=center|0:4 | Dinamo Moscow | (June 7, 1984) |} ===Final=== ==External links== * Complete calendar. helmsoccer.narod.ru * 1984 Soviet Cup.
